W) Nickel 
X) Iron 
Y) Scandium 
Z) Cadmium

linkage to sphingosine [SFING-guh-seen], what is the fundamental structural unit common to 
all sphingolipids?

program, infrared emission from most galaxies comes primarily from three sources. Name two 
of them.
bonusA: STARS, INTERSTELLAR GAS, DUST (ACCEPT: INTERSTELLAR DUST)

tossupQ:

X) Convergent 
Y) Analogous [uh-NAL-uh-guhs] 
Z) Divergent

X) Hookworm

tossupQ:

equation  [y equals R times one half to the power of the quantity x over

If 1000 grams were present initially, how many grams will remain after 900 years? 
 
W) 62.5 
X) 125 
Y) 250 
Z) 500

Y) Both use moderators to control energy output 
Z) Both use water to control heat build-up
tossupA: X) BOTH HEAT WATER TO BECOME STEAM

tossupQ:
CHEMISTRY  Short Answer  According to valence bond theory, what is the hybridization of 
the central atom of methane?
bonusQ:
CHEMISTRY  Short Answer  A lab performs atomic spectroscopy, usually using a flame as 
an excitation source. However, flames only ionize a very small percentage of the atoms, so the 
lab wants to find a better excitation source. Name a common source that could be used to solve 
this problem.
bonusA:
PLASMA (ACCEPT: PLASMA EMISSION, INDUCTIVELY COUPLED PLASMA 
SOURCE, OR ICP)

water was once present on Mars? 
 
W) Large flood channels 
X) Sedimentary layering 
Y) Sand dunes  
Z) Eroded craters
bonusQ:
EARTH AND SPACE  Short Answer  What is the typical adjective used to describe a 
volcano that is not currently erupting but is considered likely to do so in the future?

tossupQ:
PHYSICS  Multiple Choice  An unpowered open truck is coasting horizontally with a 
constant velocity along a frictionless track underneath a grain bin when grain falls vertically into 
the truck, partly filling it as it moves along. Which of the following will happen to the horizontal 
momentum of the truck with the accumulating grain? 
 
W) It will decrease 
X) It will increase 
Y) It will stay the same  
Z) It will first increase and then decrease
tossupA: Y) IT WILL STAY THE SAME
bonusQ:
PHYSICS  Short Answer  A mass is suspended by two springs of equal length connected in 
parallel. The mass stretches the springs by a distance A beyond their equilibrium length. The 
springs are rearranged to be connected in series, so that now the mass stretches the springs by 
a distance B beyond their equilibrium length. By number, identify which of the following is true: 
1) A is greater than B, 2) A is less than B, 3) A and B are the same distance.

tossupQ:
MATH  Multiple Choice  The lines y = (a – 5)x + 5 [ y equals open parentheses a minus 5 
close parentheses x plus 5] and y = -2x + 7 are perpendicular if a equals which of the 
following? 
 
W) -2/9 
X) 9/2 
Y) 5 
Z) 11/2
bonusQ:
MATH  Short Answer  For a function f(x), suppose that you know that f(-1) = -2 and that   
f(3) = 2. What would you need to know about f in order to invoke the Intermediate Value 
Theorem to conclude that there is at least one zero of f on [-1, 3] [the closed interval from 
negative 1 to 3]?
bonusA: f IS CONTINUOUS ON [-1, 3] (ACCEPT: F IS CONTINOUS ON THE INTERVAL)

tossupQ:
BIOLOGY  Multiple Choice  Which of the following examples describes a postzygotic 
reproductive barrier that creates or enforces reproductive isolation? 
 
W) Two closely-related species of garter snakes live in the same area, but one lives mainly in 
water while the other lives mainly on land 
X) Two species of closely-related skunks have different mating seasons 
Y) Two species of closely-related snails have morphological differences that prevent successful 
inter-species mating 
Z) Two species of closely related equines may successfully mate to produce offspring, but the 
offspring is sterile
tossupA:
Z) TWO SPECIES OF CLOSELY RELATED EQUINES MAY SUCCESSFULLY 
MATE TO PRODUCE OFFSPRING, BUT THE OFFSPRING IS STERILE
bonusQ:
BIOLOGY  Multiple Choice  Which of the following is true of the twenty common amino 
acids? 
 
W) They contain a primary amine and secondary alcohol 
X) They contain a primary amide and a primary alcohol 
Y) They contain a primary amine and a primary carboxyl group 
Z) They contain a secondary amine and a primary carboxyl group
bonusA: Y) THEY CONTAIN A PRIMARY AMINE AND A PRIMARY CARBOXYL GROUP
